required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Immunogenicity, and Pharmacodynamics of JNJ-64179375 in Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A 3-Part First-in-Human Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Immunogenicity, and Pharmacodynamics of JNJ-64179375 in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of JNJ-64179375 in Part 1 (Intravenous dose) and Part 3 (Subcutaneous dose) and potential for reversibility of JNJ-64179375 induced Pharmacodynamic effects on coagulation parameters and platelet function (Part 2) in healthy male participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AE) as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
Part 3: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AE) as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
Part 2: Change From Baseline in Potential for Reversibility of the JNJ-64179375 Induced Pharmacodynamic Effects on Coagulation Parameters
primary_outcome.description: Change in Potential for Reversibility of the JNJ-64179375 will be assessed by assessing the change in thrombin time as coagulation parameter.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Change From Baseline in Potential for Reversibility of the JNJ-64179375 Induced Pharmacodynamic Effects on Platelet Function
primary_outcome.description: Platelet function will be assessed by measuring platelet activation and aggregation in response to thrombin and other agonists and with the platelet function analyzer (PFA)100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 and 3: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as maximum observed plasma concentration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 and 3: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: The (AUC [0-last]) is defined as Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 to the time corresponding to the last quantifiable serum concentration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 and 3: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to Infinite Time (AUC [0-infinity]) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: The (AUC [0-infinity]) is defined as Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 to infinity with extrapolation of the terminal phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 and 3: Terminal Half-Life (t1/2) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: Half-life (t[1/2]) is associated with the terminal slope (lambda [z]) of the semi-logarithmic drug concentration-time curve, calculated as 0.693/lambda(z).

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Total Systemic Clearance (CL) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: CL is defined as total systemic clearance after intravenous administration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Terminal Phase After Intravenous Administration (Vz) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: Vz is defined as the Apparent volume of distribution at terminal phase after intravenous administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax is defined as time to the maximum observed plasma concentration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Total Systemic Clearance Over Bioavailability After Subcutaneous (SC) Administration (CL/F) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: CL/F is defined as total systemic clearance over bioavailability after SC administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Terminal Phase Over Bioavailability After Subcutaneous Administration (Vz/F) of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: (Vz/F) is defined as Apparent Volume of distribution at terminal phase over bioavailability after SC administration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Absolute Bioavailability (F) After Subcutaneous Administration of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: F is defined as absolute bioavailability after SC administration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 and 3: Immunogenicity of JNJ-64179375
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples will be collected and screened for antibodies binding to JNJ-64179375 and the titer of confirmed positive samples will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of JNJ-64179375 in presence of 4-factor prothrombin complex concentrate (PCC)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as maximum observed plasma concentration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Area Under the Plasma ConcentrationTime Curve From Time Zero to Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUC [0-last]) of JNJ-64179375 in the presence of 4-factor PCC
secondary_outcome.description: The (AUC [0-last]) is defined as Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 to the time corresponding to the last quantifiable serum concentration of JNJ-64179375

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Area Under the Plasma ConcentrationTime Curve From Time Zero to Infinite Time (AUC [0-infinity]) of JNJ-64179375 in the presence of 4-factor PCC
secondary_outcome.description: The (AUC [0-infinity]) is defined as Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 to infinity with extrapolation of the terminal phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Terminal Half Life [t(1/2)] of JNJ-64179375 in the presence of 4-factor PCC
secondary_outcome.description: Half life [t(1/2)] is associated with the terminal slope (lambda [z]) of the semilogarithmic drug concentration time curve, calculated as 0.693/lambda(z).

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Total Systemic Clearance (CL) of JNJ-64179375 in the presence of 4-factor PCC
secondary_outcome.description: CL is defined as total systemic clearance after intravenous administration of JNJ-64179375.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Terminal Phase After Intravenous Administration (Vz) of JNJ-64179375 in the presence of 4-factor PCC
secondary_outcome.description: Vz is defined as the Apparent volume of distribution at terminal phase after intravenous administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Immunogenicity of JNJ-64179375 in the presence of 4-factor PCC
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples will be collected and screened for antibodies binding to JNJ-64179375 and the titer of confirmed positive samples will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AE) as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
Part 1 and 3: Pharmacodynamic Effect of JNJ-64179375 on Platelet Function
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet function will be assessed by measuring platelet activation and aggregation in response to thrombin and other agonists and with the platelet function analyzer (PFA)-100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 and 3: Pharmacodynamic Effect of JNJ-64179375 on Coagulation Parameters
secondary_outcome.description: The pharmacodynamic effect of JNJ-64179375 on coagulation parameters will be assessed by measuring the change in thrombin time.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 1 (0.03 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Participants in a ratio of 3:1 will receive a single 0.03 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) intravenous (IV) dose of JNJ-64179375 or matching placebo on Day 1.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 2 (0.1 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Participants in a ratio of 3:1 will receive a single 0.1 mg/kg IV dose of JNJ-64179375 or matching placebo on Day 1.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 3 (0.3 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Participants in a ratio of 3:1 will receive a single 0.3 mg/kg IV dose of JNJ-64179375 or matching placebo on Day 1.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 4 (1.0 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Participants in a ratio of 3:1 will receive a single 1.0 mg/kg IV dose of JNJ-64179375 or matching placebo on Day 1.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 5 (2.5 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Participants in a ratio of 3:1 will receive a single 2.5 mg/kg IV dose of JNJ-64179375 or matching placebo on Day 1.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 6 (5.0 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Participants in a ratio of 3:1 will receive a single 5.0 mg/kg IV dose of JNJ-64179375 or matching placebo on Day 1.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 7 (Escalation Dose of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Dose escalation will proceed until the toxicology study exposure limits or a highest tolerable dose will be reached.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Cohort 8 (Escalation Dose of JNJ-64179375 or Placebo)
arm_group.description: Dose escalation will proceed until the toxicology study exposure limits or a highest tolerable dose will be reached.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 2: Reversal Cohort :(50 IU/kg of 4-factor PCC)
arm_group.description: Participants will receive a 2.5 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or highest tolerable dose if lower than 2.5 mg/kg followed by administration of a single IV 50 International Unit per kilogram (IU/Kg) dose of a 4 factor prothrombin complex concentrate (PCC) or matching placebo on Day 1.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 3: Subcutaneous Cohort (1.0 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375)
arm_group.description: Participants will receive a Single Subcutaneous (SC) dose of 1.0 mg.kg or highest tolerable dose if less than 1.0 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375 or matching placebo on Day 1.

intervention.description: During part 1, participants will receive a single ascending Intravenous dose of JNJ-64179375 ranging from (0.03 mg/kg to 5.0 mg/kg). In Part 2, participants will receive a 2.5 mg/kg or highest tolerable dose if lower than 2.5 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375. In Part 3, participants will receive a Single Subcutaneous (SC) dose of 1.0 mg/kg or highest tolerable dose if less than 1.0 mg/kg of JNJ-64179375.

intervention.description: Participants will randomly receive matching placebo in all 3 Parts on day 1 administered via IV Route (for Part 1 and 2) and SC route (for Part 3).

intervention.description: Following a single dose of JNJ-64179375, participants will receive a single IV dose of 4 factor-PCC.
intervention.arm_group_label: Part 2: Reversal Cohort :(50 IU/kg of 4-factor PCC)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index [weight kilogram per meter square (kg/m^2)] between 18 and 30 kg/m^2 (inclusive), and body weight greater than 50 kilogram (kg) but less than 100 kg
- Generally in good health on the basis of physical examination, medical history, vital signs, laboratory tests, and electrocardiogram (ECG) performed at screening and/or prior to administration of the initial dose of study drug
- Must sign an informed consent form (ICF) indicating that he understands the purpose of, and procedures required for, the study and is willing to participate in the study
- contraceptive use by men should be consistent with local regulations regarding the use of contraceptive methods for subject participating in clinical studies
- willing and able to adhere to the study visit schedule and other requirements, prohibitions, and restrictions specified in this protocol through the Day 113 visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute illness, including an upper respiratory infection (with or without fever), within 7 days prior to study drug administration or have had a major illness or hospitalization within 1 month prior to study drug administration
- Clinically significant abnormal values for coagulation, hematology, clinical chemistry or urinalysis at screening or on Day -1 (at admission to the clinical research unit) as determined by the investigator or appropriate designee
- Have smoked tobacco or nicotine-related products within 6 months prior to dosing or does not agree to refrain through Day 113
- Donated blood or blood products or had substantial loss of blood [more than 500 milliliter (mL)] within 3 months before the first administration of study drug or intends to donate or donates blood or blood products during the study until 30 days after completion
- History of or current clinically significant medical illness including (but not limited to) cardiac arrhythmias or other cardiac disease, hematologic disease, bleeding or thrombotic disorders

overall_official.last_name: Janssen Research & Development, LLC Clinical Trial
